Table of Contents

Name


build-sss0 -- install LINUX on a system support station level 0 (SSS0)

Synopsis


build-sss0 -c cab_num -p cab_pos -d disk

Description


boot-sss0 installs LINUX on an SSS0. cab_num is the number of the system support cabinet in which the CPU resides. cab_pos is the position of the CPU within the cabinet. Numbers are zero based. disk defines the type of harddisk. Valid disk types are hda and sda. build-sss0 adds an entry to sss0-config and then calls install-os. It also adds a route to /etc/sysconfig/static-routes which defines a route to the SSS0's second ethernet card. After LINUX is installed udpate-sss0, udpate-sbin and update-ct are called to install cplant tools.

Notes


The LINUX distribution which is installed on the SSS0 is copied from nfs-root-alpha.

Limitations


This script assumes 8 SSS0's to a cabinet. The sss0 must have already been discovered.

Author


Michael Levenhagen

See Also


update-sss0, update-sbin, update-ct, install-os, /cplant/sss0-config /cplant/nfs-root-alpha /etc/sysconfig/static-routes
